result.execSummary:
The defendant David Lee Grady III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent with 14CT2469, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 117 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

Defendant to pay forfeiture in the amount of $1,800.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments and are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to  Drug Abuse Correctional Center Attn. Stephanie P.O.Box 36 Winnebago, WI 54985-0036

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 28 Judge Sanders.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Lee Grady in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant David Lee Grady in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 and 3 DISMISSED to be used as a read-in on COUNT 1.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 MONTHS, concurrent with 14CT2469, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 117 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $      payable to 
-Defendant to pay forfeiture in the amount of $1,800.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
-Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 2 years
-Court ordered ignition interlock for 2 years

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant David Lee Grady not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court involved in a jury trial.  Matter rescheduled for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant David Lee Grady not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense needs to obtaina global offer.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant David Lee Grady not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense needs a global offer.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program DISCHARGE (due to custody status) report received and filed.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant David Lee Grady not in court, in custody.  Megan Carmody for Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requested more time as the defenant has a new case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-25-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Lee Grady in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant David Lee Grady in custody.  Ronald Dague, appearing for Michael Lonski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.

Defendant David Lee Grady in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant David Lee Grady in custody.  
Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty as to Count 1 and Count 2. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
